title: The Informer
description: The prisoners create an elaborate underground ruse to fool a German spy that has been placed in their ranks.

title: Hold That Tiger
description: Learning that the German army is manufacturing an improved Tiger tank, Hogan and his men are determined to steal one, so they can disassemble it and make blueprints for the Allies.

title: Kommandant of the Year
description: Knowing that the Allies won't bomb one of their own prisoner-of-war camps, the Germans store a secret rocket at Stalag 13 until its base on the Atlantic coast is completed. Hogan creates a phony "Kommandant of the Year" award as a diversion for his real plan to sabotage the weapon.

title: The Late Inspector General
description: During a visit by the Inspector General, Hogan's men try to prevent the inept Colonel Klink from being transferred to the Russian Front. When their plan works too well and Klink is promoted to a position in Berlin, the POWs must get Klink unpromoted.

title: The Flight of the Valkyrie
description: Hogan's efforts to help a German baroness to escape are thwarted by Klink, who has arranged for the transfer of a British prisoner who is senior to Colonel Hogan.

title: The Prisoner's Prisoner
description: When a British commando unit is captured before they can blow up a crucial German ammo dump, Hogan and his men attempt to finish the job.

title: German Bridge Is Falling Down
description: When the Air Force can't knock out an important German bridge, Hogan decides to try to destroy it from the ground, but he's short on explosives. Carter's efforts to manufacture some only destroy some of the tunnels underneath the prison camp, so Hogan decides to steal gunpowder from the German ammunition hut by covering the building with graffiti and then breaking into it while his men repaint it.

title: Movies Are Your Best Escape
description: Hogan wants to get a peek at the documents that a visiting general has.

title: Go Light on the Heavy Water
description: Hogan convinces Kommandant Klink that the heavy water being stored at Stalag 13 is a youth potion.

title: Top Hat, White Tie and Bomb Sights
description: Using the microphone that Klink has installed in the barracks, Hogan tricks Klink into contacting an underground member.

title: Happiness Is a Warm Sergeant
description: After Klink finds Sergeant Schultz drunk he gets a tough new replacement.

title: The Scientist
description: Corporal LeBeau pretends to be a visiting French scientist while Hogan smuggles out the real one.

title: Hogan's Hofbrau
description: Hogan sneaks out of camp to a local German Hofbrau House to get the details of a nearby German army unit.

title: Oil for the Lamps of Hogan
description: The Germans want to safely build a synthetic fuel plant in Stalag 13, but Hogan convinces them that there is oil beneath the camp.

title: Reservations Are Required
description: During an operation to send out twenty Allied soldiers, one of them escapes early and is captured.

title: Anchors Aweigh, Men of Stalag 13
description: The Germans are looking for an escaped prisoner named Michaels who also happens to have made off with a German gun sight. It falls on Hogan and his men to get Michaels and the gun sight to England. To accomplish this Hogan convinces Klink he is fatigued and should have an Officer's Club to relax in. The ploy works and they begin to build it but are actually building a boat with the plan of sailing Michaels out.

title: Happy Birthday, Adolf
description: Hogan and his men must destroy a German artillery unit so that the Allies can send in a bombing raid on Hitler's birthday.

title: The Gold Rush
description: The Germans have stolen a gold shipment from the French and Hogan must convince Klink to have it moved to the safety of Stalag 13.

title: Hello, Zolle
description: While Hogan detains a German general during an Allied offensive, a Gestapo officer looks into Stalag 13's perfect escape record.

title: It Takes a Thief... Sometimes
description: Hogan's latest underground contacts are secretly German spies.

title: The Great Impersonation
description: Sergeant Schultz impersonates Klink in a scheme to get some of his men free from the Gestapo.

title: The Pizza Parlor
description: To get a Italian officer to defect, they use pizza to tempt him.

title: The 43rd, a Moving Story
description: Hogan has a mission to destroy a local artillery battery, but Klink's new tough second-in-command is impeding the heroes.

title: How to Cook a German Goose by Radar
description: A new prisoner in a corporal's uniform turns out to be a general with a mission for Hogan.

title: Psychic Kommandant
description: In a plot to get to an airplane with a silent engine, Hogan gets Klink to believe that he is psychic.

title: The Prince from the Phone Company
description: An African prince comes to Stalag 13 who is negotiating with the Germans for the rights in his country to built a submarine base and Hogan replaces him with Kinchloe.

title: The Safecracker Suite
description: Klink helps an old friend by assisting Hogan in the theft of the plans for an assassination on the Fuehrer.

title: I Look Better in Basic Black
description: Three American women show up at Stalag 13 and Hogan wants to know why.

title: The Assassin
description: As Hogan tries to help a German scientist defect and bumbling Colonel Crittendon interferes again.

title: Cupid Comes to Stalag 13
description: Hogan wants Klink to forget about a promotion so he plays cupid for him and General Burkhalter's sister.

title: The Flame Grows Higher
description: There seems to be a traitor in the escaped prisoner pipeline and Hogan has to find him by following the escape route.

title: Request Permission to Escape
description: Carter receives a Dear John letter and wants to join the rest of the prisoners that escape and go home.

title: Hogan Gives a Birthday Party
description: Two shot down pilots are in Stalag 13 and inform Hogan that allied planes are having a difficult time getting past German defenses to blow up a refinery. Hogan devises a scheme to use a German plane to blow it. The plan is complicated when Hogan discovers that the General who has the plane has made Hogan and his thinking a study of his.

title: The Schultz Brigade
description: Klink is caught in a conspiracy with Colonels Burmeister and Bussie to discredit General Burkhalter with the Gestapo. Burkhalter knows something is up and has the three arrested. Hogan is worried that a new Kommandant could replace Klink should he be found guilty. He must come up with a plan to get Klink back on the General's good side.

title: Diamonds in the Rough
description: A milk maiden comes into camp selling milk and secretly sneaks a note to Hogan. He is to rendezvous with her at night in the woods. Hogan suspects a trap but meets her anyway. Hogan's suspicions are correct and she betrays him and hands him over to a Gestapo officer who knows all about Hogan and his operation. He wants one million dollars in diamonds or he will blow the whistle on Hogan and his men.

title: Operation Briefcase
description: London airdrops a man codenamed Hercules near the camp. At the same time General Stauffen will be conducting an inspection of Stalag 13. Hercules' mission is to switch his briefcase with Stauffens. Stauffen is part of the plot to assassinate Hitler and Hercules' briefcase is equipped with a time bomb. Everything is proceeding as planned until Schultz unknowingly arms the bomb.

title: The Battle of Stalag 13
description: Hogan and his men smuggle a woman into the camp. Her name is Greta and she is a member of the Hammelburg Underground. She informs Hogan that his sabotage efforts in the area have the Gestapo whipped into a frenzy and that it is jeopardizing their efforts to smuggle out escaped prisoners. While this is going on, a Wehrmacht General wants to use Stalag 13 as a rest camp for Wehrmacht officers at the same time a Gestapo Colonel has designs on the camp as an interrogation facility for Hammelburg citizens. Hogan and his men play the two officers against each other while helping Greta with her problems.

title: The Rise and Fall of Sergeant Schultz
description: Hogan is stymied over how to rescue a captured member of the underground until a potential diversion - in the form of an old WWI buddy of Sgt. Schultz.

title: Hogan Springs
description: Hogan manages to free four underground leaders from the Germans and smuggles the quartet into Stalag 13. But a plan to spirit the men off to freedom in England suddenly looks hopeless when a leaky pipe fills the gang's emergency tunnel with water!

title: A Klink, a Bomb and a Short Fuse
description: All goes well when Hogan's gang steals Klink's code book from his safe, photograph the contents, and returns it to its proper place. But there's a small hitch - Carter forgets to load the camera with film!

title: Tanks for the Memory
description: When Newkirk discovers a new radio-controlled tank that could win the war for Germany, the allies want Hogan and the men to photograph the tank and then destroy it - but complications ensue during their mission.

title: A Tiger Hunt in Paris: Part 1
description: "Tiger," a female underground agent, is arrested while trying to document some secret German bases and is held in Paris for questioning. So Hogan and LeBeau become stowaways aboard Klink's staff car and head for Paris to free her.

title: A Tiger Hunt in Paris: Part 2
description: While trying to free the underground agent "Tiger" in Paris, Hogan must seek help from a Parisian fortune teller and also enlist the aid of a man who is a look-alike for Nazi Police Chief Heinrich Himmler!

title: Will the Real Adolf Please Stand Up?
description: With camp security raised, Hogan and his men are desperate to smuggle some top-secret of German fortifications to allies. The solution? Make liberal use of Carter's remarkable impersonation of Adolf Hitler!

title: Don't Forget to Write
description: The aristocratic Colonel Klink fails a routine physical exam and lands a combat assignment at the Russian front! Fearing a hard-line replacement at Stalag 13, the men must do all they can to rescind Klink's marching papers.

title: Klink's Rocket
description: Hogan and his men make plans to lure Luftwaffe bombers within range of an allied anti-craft installation hidden in an abandoned warehouse, but Carter makes shambles of the plan when, while "leaking" the info to Klink, he forgets the name of the town where the strategic warehouse is located.

title: Information Please
description: Suspecting a security leak at Stalag 13, Gen. Burkhalter goes fishing with some false information and Col. Hogan falls for the bait. As a result, Burkhalter plants a spy among the prisoners to expose the guilty parties.

title: Art for Hogan's Sake
description: An assertive Gen. Burkhalter "requisitions" the famous douard Manet painting, The Fife Player," from the Louvre museum in Paris to give to Hermann Goering as a birthday present. Undaunted by seeming impossible logistics, Hogan and LeBeau decide to steal it back!

title: The General Swap
description: Col. Hogan is less than thrilled when he is assigned to help an obnoxious American general flee Stalag 13 - and the secret plan, involving a prisoner swap, winds up as trying and difficult as the arrogant escapee himself.

title: The Great Brinksmeyer Robbery
description: When the gang's hidden cache of money - needed to purchase a secret map - goes up in smoke, the men of Stalag 13 must come up with a way to replace the cash - and decide to pull off a bank heist in the nearby town.

title: Praise the Fuhrer and Pass the Ammunition
description: Hogan and his men are determined to create chaos during some staged war games a ruthless Nazi colonel has scheduled near Stalag 13. So what do you suppose would happen if the fake explosives planned for the exercises were somehow replaced with live ammunition?

title: Hogan and the Lady Doctor
description: Hogan nixes a mission to destroy a synthetic fuel plant because the caper is too risky...but he is overruled - and forced to participate in the scheme by the ploy's mastermind, a strong-willed determined female scientist.

title: The Swing Shift
description: Masquerading as German workers, Hogan and the crew have made elaborate and foolproof plans to blow a German cannon factory sky-high - but their plan backfires when Newkirk winds up being drafted into the German army.

title: Heil Klink
description: When an important Gestapo official wants to defect, Hogan brings him to Stalag 13 - and convinces Col. Klink that the fugitive is Adolf Hitler in disguise...who is trying to elude assassins by hiding at the camp.

title: Everyone Has a Brother-in-Law
description: Capt. Kurtz, Gen. Burkhalter's brother-in-law, becomes the camp's tough new adjutant. What's worse, he's keeping a watchful eye on every corner of Stalag 13 and ends up getting in the way of Hogan's plans to blow up an enemy munitions train.

title: Killer Klink
description: The bumbling Sgt. Schultz has unwittingly been conned into making a trip to Heidelberg as a courier for the underground, but after upsetting Col. Klink, the sergeant is ordered to remain grounded at the camp. How will Hogan and the gang win him a new weekend pass?

title: Reverend Kommandant Klink
description: Lt. Claude Boucher's plane is shot down and he is brought to Stalag 13 to be interrogated by Major Hochstetter. Boucher refuses to give any information so Hochstetter employs the tactic of casting doubts on his fiances honor. Hogan is worried this may get results so his plan is to smuggle the girl into camp to prove she is still loyal to Boucher.

title: The Most Escape-Proof Camp I've Ever Escaped From
description: Col. Klink's "no escape" record is jeopardized when Malcom Flood, a British escape artist, lands in Stalag 13 and intends to continue his impressive escape record - a plan likely to endanger Col. Hogan's scheduled rendezvous with an OSS agent.

title: The Tower
description: When the Nazis construct a new communications tower near Stalag 13 - one that is potentially deadly to the allies - Hogan enlists a beautiful underground agent to help destroy the tower, with Kinchloe assigned to snap some incriminating photos of Gen. Burkhalter.

title: Colonel Klink's Secret Weapon
description: After receiving a "poor" rating from the Inspector General of prison camps, Col. Klink brings in stern new sergeant to discipline the prisoners. How can Hogan and his men make sure the camp's ruthless "discipline machine" has the shortest reign possible?

title: The Top Secret Top Coat
description: A secret military document is mistakenly hidden in Col. Klink's topcoat at a party, and a desperate Hogan must nab the document because of both its value to the allies and because Klink will be charged with treason and replaced at Stalag 13 if it is discovered in his possession.

title: The Reluctant Target
description: Klink becomes convinced that he is marked for assassination by a mysterious "Mr. X" after a series of close calls at the stalag. Could Hogan be behind the threats? Yes...but it's all part of a plan to masquerade as Klink in order to help a valuable underground agent escape the camp!

title: The Crittendon Plan
description: Bumbling British Colonel Crittedon again disrupts Hogan's plans to get out an Allied officer.

title: Some of Their Planes Are Missing
description: The Germans have whipped up a plot to send Germans into England in captured Allied planes.

title: D-Day at Stalag 13
description: To help the allied invasion at Normandy, Hogan convinces the Germans that Klink has been promoted to Chief of Staff.

title: Sergeant Schultz Meets Mata Hari
description: A Gestapo female operative tries to lure secrets out of Sergeant Schultz.

title: Funny Thing Happened on the Way to London
description: Winston Chuchill's right hand man Group Captain "Robbie" Roberts, who also happens to be a close friend of Hogan, is shot down, captured and brought to Stalag 13. However, it is all part of a Luftwaffe scheme to assassinate Churchill as Roberts is put in the cooler while an impostor is to escape and head to England to carry out the job. However, Hogan finds out what is going on and makes plans for the real Roberts to escape while the impostor stays in Luftwaffe custody.

title: Casanova Klink
description: General Burkhalter comes to Stalag 13 determined to marry off his sister to Klink. Hogan has to find a German agent in the underground.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence Nazis
description: Hogan tempts a Swedish scientist to defect.

title: Nights in Shining Armor
description: The heroes need to get both a member of the French resistance and some bullet proof vests out of Stalag 13.

title: Hot Money
description: The Germans have set up a money counterfeiting operation in the camp and Hogan is planning on destroying it.

title: One in Every Crowd
description: An American prisoner of war has information on Hogan that he wants to sell to the Germans.

title: Is General Hammerschlag Burning?
description: Hogan takes Kinchloe to Paris to visit a friend of his who might help them get plans for the defense of Paris.

title: A Russian Is Coming
description: A disagreeable Russian pilot wants to escape, but refuses to go first to London. He wants to head east to Mother Russia.

title: An Evening of Generals
description: Posing as waiters, the heroes want to get rid of a room full of German generals.

title: Everybody Loves a Snowman
description: With Major Hochstetter in the camp, Hogan has extra trouble trying to smuggle out a bomber crew especially after they are moved from their usual barracks.

title: The Hostage
description: Planting a fuel depot right outside Stalag 13, a German general is tempting Hogan. Marya the white Russian also shows up again.

title: Carter Turns Traitor
description: The location of a chemical plant is the prize when Hogan gets Carter to become a traitor.

title: Two Nazis for the Price of One
description: A Gestapo officer who knows all about the Stalag 13 operation blackmails Hogan to find out about the Manhattan Project.

title: Is There a Doctor in the House?
description: Klink's illness causes problems for one of Hogan's plots.

title: Hogan, Go Home
description: The Allied Command orders Colonel Hogan to leave and turn over his operations to the bumbling Colonel Crittendon.

title: Sticky Wicket Newkirk
description: Newkirk sneaks a beautiful woman into camp who turns out to be a Gestapo agent.

title: War Takes a Holiday
description: Hogan convinces Klink and the Gestapo that the war is over so that they will release some prisoners.

title: Duel of Honor
description: Hogan helps Klink prepare for a hasty trip to Argentina when he finds himself in a duel.

title: Axis Annie
description: Using the German propaganda radio network, Hogan gets information to the underground.

title: What Time Does the Balloon Go Up?
description: Hogan helps an escapee go out of camp in a balloon.

title: LeBeau and the Little Old Lady
description: LeBeau says that he keeps rendezvousing with a little old lady who is actually young and beautiful.

title: How to Escape from Prison Camp Without Really Trying
description: Hogan has trouble trying to get thirty prisoners out of camp.

title: The Collector General
description: A collection of stolen art comes to Stalag 13 and Hogan decides to steal it.

title: The Ultimate Weapon
description: Hogan makes the Germans think that Schultz has ESP to get them to move their anti-aircraft defenses.

title: Monkey Business
description: Hogan's latest escapee is a chimp from the local zoo who helps them deliver a radio part to the underground.

title: Drums Along the Dusseldorf
description: A German truck carrying an experimental jet fuel is the latest target for Hogan and his men. But when all efforts to sabotage the shipment fail, Carter gets down to business with the remaining weaponry at hand - a bow and arrow.

title: Clearance Sale at the Black Market
description: How can Hogan and his crew keep Sgt. Schultz from being transferred to the Russian Front?

title: Klink vs. the Gonculator
description: Coming up with a fake secret device, the gonculator, Klink brings to Stalag 13 the electronics expert who wants to defect.

title: How to Catch a Papa Bear
description: The Gestapo sets a trap for the elusive underground agent known as 'Papa Bear' (Hogan) and Newkirk gets caught.

title: Hogan's Trucking Service... We Deliver the Factory to You
description: Colonel Crittendon shows up again and messes up Hogan's plans to destroy a ball bearing plant.

title: To the Gestapo with Love
description: The Gestapo brings three lovely ladies into the camp to interrogate the prisoners.

title: Man's Best Friend Is Not His Dog
description: Hogan's crew is chasing a dog around after it buries a bone that contains pictures of a new German tank.

title: Never Play Cards with Strangers
description: Plans to destroy a nearby rocket fuel plant don't go as Hogan would like.

title: Color the Luftwaffe Red
description: Hogan and his crew volunteer to paint Luftwaffe headquarters to get a secret map of base locations.

title: Guess Who Came to Dinner?
description: Hogan makes arrangements for a contact to get to London and then suspects that she is a traitor.

title: No Names Please
description: An American journalist is rescued by Hogan and then an anonymous piece on his operations appears in an American newspaper.

title: Bad Day in Berlin
description: An American agent enters Germany and then works with Hogan's people to get a German officer out of Berlin.

title: Will the Blue Baron Strike Again?
description: Hogan tricks Klink into throwing a party for a German World War I ace so that Hogan can find the location of his headquarters.

roles.char: Girl at Party with the Baron

title: Will the Real Colonel Klink Please Stand Up Against the Wall?
description: When Carter in the disguise of the camp kommandant and is seen near one of their operations, Klink could end up being tried for treason.

title: Man in a Box
description: Hogan is hot on the trail of capturing LeBeau, but not too quickly since he has a mission to complete.

title: The Missing Klink
description: Hogan wants to kidnap Burkhalter and trade him for a captured underground agent and instead finds out that Klink is his hostage.

title: Who Stole My Copy of Mein Kampf?
description: Klink is getting an award from a lovely Allied defector and Hogan plans to get to her first.

title: Operation Hannibal
description: The heroes enlist the daughter of a German general to get to photograph his secret plans.

title: My Favorite Prisoner
description: Hogan provides information to a German baroness that includes phony invasion plans.

title: Watch the Trains Go By
description: By arranging a rendezvous between Klink and Burkhalter's sister, Hogan can slip out of camp and destroy a train.

title: Klink's Old Flame
description: When one of Klink's old friends goes on his honeymoon, Hogan hitches a ride to get some radios to Paris.

title: Up in Klink's Room
description: Hogan goes to the hospital to get information from a wounded contact.

title: The Purchasing Plan
description: Hogan has a touchy mission to deliver ammunition to the underground.

title: The Witness
description: The Germans are sending Hogan to America demanding surrender along with another surprise.

title: The Big Dish
description: An anti-aircraft system designed by an English woman has to be destroyed.

title: The Return of Major Bonacelli
description: An Italian officer helps Hogan photograph a Luftwaffe airbase.

title: Happy Birthday, Dear Hogan
description: For Colonel Hogan's birthday his crew decides to give him one ammunition dump freshly destroyed.

title: Hogan Goes Hollywood
description: To get information out, Hogan makes use of an American actor that is appearing in a German propaganda film.

title: The Well
description: A stolen German codebook is useless after Newkirk accidentally drops it down a well.

title: The Klink Commandos
description: Klink and Hogan's men together head to the Russian front on a suicide mission to steal some secret documents.

title: The Gasoline War
description: A gas station has just been set up inside Stalag 13 and Hogan plans to blow it up.

title: Unfair Exchange
description: Hogan uses Burkhalter's sister as a pawn to get back a captured Allied spy.

title: The Kommandant Dies at Dawn
description: Again Hogan uses Klink to deliver information to the underground and this time the Gestapo finds it on him.

title: Bombsight
description: Hogan wants to get the plans for a new German bomb sight.

title: The Big Picture
description: Klink is being blackmailed by the Gestapo and Hogan plans to help him.

title: The Big Gamble
description: Hogan receives orders to get a secret box off a plane that went down near Stalag 13.

title: The Defector
description: Hochstetter traces a defecting Field Marshall to Stalag 13.

title: The Empty Parachute
description: Hogan plants an empty parachute in the camp sending the Germans on a wild goose chase for a downed Allied agent.

title: The Antique
description: Hogan gets Klink to deal in supposedly rare cuckoo clocks so that he can send out information.

title: Is There a Traitor in the House?
description: Newkirk poses as a traitor to send information via a propaganda radio broadcast.

title: At Last- Schultz Knows Something
description: Schultz has been guarding a secret nuclear facility and Hogan wants to get its location out of him.

title: How's the Weather?
description: Throwing a party for Klink, the prisoners use the party balloons to get weather information.

title: Get Fit or Go Fight
description: Hogan has to get Klink back into shape or Burkhalter plans to send him to the Russian Front.

title: Fat Hermann, Go Home
description: Marya the White Russian uses Schultz to impersonate Goering just as Hogan is trying to save a trainload of stolen art.

title: The Softer They Fall
description: Kinchloe participates in a camp boxing match to divert attention from Hogan's planned heist.

title: Gowns by Yvette
description: Burkhalter's niece is getting married and by having LeBeau design her wedding gown, Hogan is going to smuggle a defector out of Germany.

title: One Army at a Time
description: Dressed in a German uniform for an operation, Carter finds himself serving in the German army.

title: Standing Room Only
description: Hogan has to save Klink when his account books at Stalag 13 aren't quite correct.

title: Six Lessons from Madame LaGrange
description: Hogan and a German singer try and stop the arrest of local Allied agents.

title: The Sergeant's Analyst
description: Burkhalter discovers Schultz goofing off and has him sent to the Russian Front.

title: The Merry Widow
description: After Klink takes the wrong papers for a rendezvous with a female contact, Hogan sends Schultz to meet the woman.

title: Crittendon's Commandos
description: Crittendon and Hogan's men try to capture Rommel very unsuccessfully.

title: Klink's Escape
description: Hogan has Klink believing that he is on the trail of a big prisoner escape operation.

title: Cuisine  la Stalag 13
description: LeBeau wants to escape leaving Stalag 13 without its resident chef.

title: The Experts
description: Hogan first saves and then helps to escape a German radio expert who the Germans want dead.

title: Klink's Masterpiece
description: Hogan convinces Klink that he is a great artist so that he can make a rendezvous in an art gallery.

title: Lady Chitterly's Lover: Part 1
description: Lord Chitterly, an English traitor who looks like the bumbling Colonel Crittendon, enters Stalag 13 with information for the Germans. Crittendon is made up to replace the Lord and fool the Germans.

title: Lady Chitterly's Lover: Part 2
description: Lord Chitterly, an English traitor who looks like the bumbling Colonel Crittendon, enters Stalag 13 with information for the Germans. Crittendon is made up to replace the Lord and fool the Germans. The real Lord escapes.

title: The Gestapo Takeover
description: The heroes try to prevent the Gestapo from sending Klink and Schultz to the Russian front.

title: Kommandant Schultz
description: Schultz is now the temporary Kommandant of Satalg 13 and starts to abuse his new power.

title: Eight O'Clock and All Is Well
description: Hogan and company tell a German mole disguised as an American all about their operation.

title: The Big Record
description: Hogan is going to use the recorder given to him by Klink to record a top secret SS meeting.

title: It's Dynamite
description: Col. Hogan and his Heroes assist local resistance forces sabotage hidden explosive stashes the Gestapo plans to use to destroy bridges and other resources as the Nazis prepare to retreat from advancing Allied Forces.

title: Operation Tiger
description: Tiger, the pretty French underground fighter, is going to be executed in Berlin and Hogan's Heroes are to the rescue.

title: The Big Broadcast
description: Radio detection equipment prohibits Hogan from using their usual radio so they borrow the one in Klink's car.

title: The Gypsy
description: LeBeau is passed off as a Gypsy fortune teller to help get a radar countermeasure device to London.

title: The Dropouts
description: Hogan has to help three German scientists escape from Stalag 13 and get to London.

title: Easy Come, Easy Go
description: Colonel Hogan and Commandant Klink go to London to steal a plane as part of a plan to ferret out German spies in England.

title: The Meister Spy
description: Posing as German officers, the heroes try to get a German spy to disclose who he was working with.

title: That's No Lady, That's My Spy
description: Disguised as a German officer's wife, Newkirk collects penicillin for the underground.

title: To Russia Without Love
description: To capture some secret papers, Hogan has a Russian woman convince Klink to volunteer for the Russian front.

title: Klink for the Defense
description: Hogan helps prove the German officer that Klink is defending innocent of treason so he can get the plans that he had stolen for the Allies.

title: The Kamikazes Are Coming
description: The heroes have to figure how to get a new type of rocket back to England.

title: Kommandant Gertrude
description: Hogan must get a US General out of camp just as General Burkhalter's sister shows up with her intended - Klink's new number two.

title: Hogan's Double Life
description: Hogan has to discredit a German officer who knows about the operations at Stalag 13.

title: Look at the Pretty Snowflakes
description: A snow avalanche is part of Hogan's plan to stall a Panzer division.

title: Rockets or Romance
description: The underground team that needs help in blowing up a missile battery include a very lovely woman.
